page.title: 04South west Nercwys _ Farming
page.content: This is a thriving agricultural area, with computerised milking parlours installed on some of the larger family farms. Milk is collected by bulk tanker, every dairy farm has to comply with the strict regulations governing the production and collection of milk. Adequate roads have to be maintained to ensure the bulk tankers access to the farm. Most farms have their own machinery and equipment for ploughing, hay making, silage cutting and collecting, but use contractors for combine harvesting, silage baling and hedge cutting. The sheep are sheared by contract shearers. The wool is collected by the wool marketing board from one collection point. Stock is taken to the weekly livestock markets at Mold, Ruthin and Chester. Special sheep sales are held.
